AttachInstances.title: Adding an instance to a scaling group

AttachLoadBalancers.title: Adding the classic CLB `lb-crhgatrf` to the security group
Adding the application CLB `lb-23aejgcv` (listener: lbl-ncw704sn, forwarding rule ID: loc-l3hmaev9) to the scaling group

ClearLaunchConfigurationAttributes.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: as.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: ClearLaunchConfigurationAttributes
<Common request parameters>

{
    "LaunchConfigurationId": "asc-kr4beurf",
    "ClearDataDisks": true
}
ClearLaunchConfigurationAttributes.title: Clearing data disk information of the launch configuration

CompleteLifecycleAction.title: Completing a lifecycle action by specifying the `InstanceId`
Completing a lifecycle action by specifying the `LifecycleActionToken`

CreateAutoScalingGroup.document: This example shows you how to create a scaling group in a specified VPC and configure a layer-7 CLB.
CreateAutoScalingGroup.title: Creating a scaling group

CreateAutoScalingGroupFromInstance.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: as.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateAutoScalingGroupFromInstance
<Common request parameters>

{
    "DesiredCapacity": 0,
    "InstanceId": "ins-19a14o9y",
    "AutoScalingGroupName": "as-test",
    "MinSize": 0,
    "MaxSize": 1,
    "InheritInstanceTag": false
}
CreateAutoScalingGroupFromInstance.title: Creating a launch configuration and scaling group based on an instance

CreateLifecycleHook.document: This example shows you how to create a lifecycle hook that takes effect upon instance creation, where `DefaultResult` takes the default value `CONTINUE` and `HeartbeatTimeout` takes the default value 300 seconds.
CreateLifecycleHook.title: Creating a lifecycle hook with default values

CreateLifecycleHook.document: This example shows you how to create a lifecycle hook that takes effect upon instance creation, where `DefaultResult` is set to ABANDON and `HeartbeatTimeout` is set to 360 seconds.
CreateLifecycleHook.title: Creating a lifecycle hook

CreateLifecycleHook.document: This example shows you how to create a lifecycle hook that takes effect upon instance creation, where `DefaultResult` is set to CONTINUE and `HeartbeatTimeout` is set to 120 seconds to notify the CMQ queuing model named "one-queue".
CreateLifecycleHook.title: Creating a lifecycle hook to notify a CMQ queue

CreateLifecycleHook.document: This example shows you how to create a lifecycle hook that takes effect upon instance termination, where `DefaultResult` is set to `ABANDON` and `HeartbeatTimeout` is set to 120 seconds to notify the CMQ topic named `one-topic`.
CreateLifecycleHook.title: Creating a lifecycle hook to notify a CMQ topic

CreateNotificationConfiguration.title: Creating the notification policy for scale-out results

CreateNotificationConfiguration.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: as.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateNotificationConfiguration
<Common request parameters>

{
    "AutoScalingGroupId": "asg-pc2oqu2z",
    "NotificationTypes": [
        "SCALE_OUT_FAILED"
    ],
    "TargetType": "CMQ_QUEUE",
    "QueueName": "test-queue"
}
CreateNotificationConfiguration.title: Creating a policy to send notifications to the specified message queue for scale-out failures

CreateScalingPolicy.title: Increasing the desired capacity by one if the average CPU utilization is over 50% within 1 minute for 5 consecutive occurrences
Removing 50% instances if the average memory utilization is below 35% within 1 minute for 5 consecutive occurrences

CreateScheduledAction.document: This example shows you how to create a scheduled action to adjust the maximum, minimum, and desired capacity of the scaling group to 10, 4, and 6 respectively at 23:00, August 28, 2018 (UTC+8).
CreateScheduledAction.title: Creating a single-run scheduled action

CreateScheduledAction.document: This example shows you how to create a scheduled action to adjust the maximum, minimum, and desired capacity of a scaling group to 7, 2, and 3 respectively at 23:00 every day starting from August 28, 2018 and ending at 00:00, January 1, 2019 (UTC+8).
CreateScheduledAction.title: Creating a recurring scheduled action
